title: Is there a way to keep the 'Main Menu Toggle Button' expanded by default on www.rumble.com?
content:
Every time you launch the www.rumble.com website on Firefox, (or any other web browser for that matter), the 'Main Menu Toggle Button' (which is the 3 lines icon in the upper left hand corner), is closed or minimized by default. In order to expand the Main Menu you need to actually hover over the button itself with your mouse and click it.

Is there a way to automate the expansion of the 'Main Menu Toggle Button' to be set to open AT ALL TIMES by default without me having to manually click the 'Main Menu Toggle Button' every time? Bellow is a screenshot of how the Main Menu looks like with the 'Main Menu Toggle Button' activated. I've also added a circle around the actual 'Main Menu Toggle Button'
creator: PocketRocket

title: Does Firefox require the use two step verication when logging into Firefox?
content:
Is two step verification required when signing into Firefox?

AOL requires two step verification when logging into AOL.

My email address is jeanbm65@aol.com
creator: jeanbm65

title: Use of two step verification when signing into the Firefox browser
content: Is two step verification used to sign into Firefox? If so, two step verification would require the use of a phone number to send a code to the person logging in and entry of this code into a specific location or on a specific page. Logging into AOL requires two step verification. Is Firefox similar?
creator: jeanbm65

title: Blocked support popup
content: Hi, I just discovered something odd. Trying to troubleshoot something with an android app communicating via web and laptop to free up the phone, and the relevant website has a chat popup and Firefox won't open the popup. I added the website to the whitelist and saved, but still wouldn't. Tried troubleshooting mode, but nothing. Switched to Chrome and it works fine. Cleared cookies and cache and restarted Firefox, but still no luck. The website is ExpressVPN.com. Macbook Pro OS10.14, Firefox up to date, version 115.1.0esr (64-bit).
creator: cleverishmoniker

title: Slow Start Up on Ubuntu 22.04 wXFCE
content:
I have the same issue described here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1387715. However, the accepted solution was not the answer for my situation, since the ownership of the ~/.local/share/ directory was correct on my system.

In my case the slow start-up resulted from the xdg-desktop-portal-gtk service failing to start because of DISPLAY setting issue. This was a difficult issue to debug, since the console wasn't showing timeout errors resulting from Firefox not being able to communicate with the xdg-desktop-portal-gtk service.

My fix was is elegant, but works:

  1. Edit /usr/lib/systemd/user/xdg-desktop-portal-gtk.service and add the line Environment="DISPLAY=:1.0" under the "[Service]" line.
  2. sudo systemctl daemon-reload
  3. systemctl --user restart xdg-desktop-portal-gtk
  4. To get the service to start correctly every time I start a VNC server, I also added this line (systemctl --user restart xdg-desktop-portal-gtk) to my ~/.vnc/xstartup file

While I think this solution will continue to work, because my DISPLAY is always :1.0 when I use Firefox, I would rather have the xdg-desktop-portal-gtk service figure out the correct DISPLAY setting. Are there any suggestions on how to do that? Or, is there a way to configure Firefox to not rely on this service?
creator: kgs068wer

title: FireFox Version 116.0.3 (64- bit)
content: Recently while using the address bar to search for car parts with Google, many of the links displayed do not work. Some do nothing and some never connect, though it look like it's trying. Chrome does not seem to have that problem.
